benchmark_details.name: AccessEval (Accessibility Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: AccessEval is a benchmark evaluating 21 closed- and open-source LLMs across 6 real-world domains and 9 disability types using paired Neutral and Disability-Aware Queries to systematically investigate disability bias in large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and mitigate disability bias in large language models and promote more inclusive AI applications.

data.source: Generated dataset of paired queries comprising Neutral Queries and Disability-Aware Queries.
data.annotation: Manual validation combined with automated generation processes.

methodology.calculation: Performance degradation is calculated by comparing scores of responses to Neutral Queries versus Disability-Aware Queries.
methodology.interpretation: Lower scores on Disability-Aware Queries indicate potential bias in model responses.
methodology.validation: Statistical correlation with human annotations was performed to validate automated metric scores.

harm: Misinformation leading to inadequate support for disabled users
